adjectives.description: woaded (comparative more woaded, superlative most woaded)

examples: Man tattoed or woaded, winter-clad in skins.

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of woad
examples: The piece which has only been woaded will be sound bluish, with somewhat of a dull green ; if it have been both woaded and maddered, it will be of a tan or minim colour; and if it have been neither woaded nor maddered, its colour will be dunniſh, between yellow and ſallow.
